column4: quick question: after I upgraded from breezy to dapper, i am getting this and few more errors when I login to bash: "unknown items QUOTAS_ENAB (notify administrator)". so how can I fix this?
why has the upgrade done to cause this error? i would appreciate your help.
you will probably find a debconf file there with the new config ( something like /etc/login.defs.debconf
just move that file in place of the old one
you probably answered a config question on it and said to keep your settings
and where is the old one?
the new one is the one that debconf backed up in case of need
the one with the extra suffix needs to be renamed to /etc/login.defs
thanks, it worked! really appreciate your help
no problem - I did the same thing as you on the upgrade - I tried to keep my old config with the result you described
evidently the login defs have changed
that is interesting, but useful information
usually the default answer is to keep your config but in this case it was a better idea to acept the new one - I should have looked at it more closely I guess :)
